13:42 <sgc072> Hi vmassol I want to discuss about the 'glossary item' webpage.  
13:46 <vmassol> sgc072: sure  
13:47 <sgc072> Want to discuss about what happens when the user clicks on a word on x-wiki. Can it be that when the user will be guided to the glossary page he will be given seggestions about that particular word on that page..  
13:48 <sgc072> Like For Example if a user is encountered with the word 'rendering'. He clicks on that word and then he will be guided to the glossary page.  
13:49 <sgc072> There he will be given suggestions about things like - 'rendering architecture', 'transformation examples' etc.  
13:49 <vmassol> sgc072: only if that word has a glossary entry  
13:50 <vmassol> as I said in comments, I don't think clicking is the best  
13:50 <vmassol> I'd say it should be displayed with a different style (to be defined) and when user hover overs it, a popup displays the explanation  
13:50 <vmassol> (with a link to go to the glossary page in that popup )  
13:51 <vmassol> this is much nicer since the user can see the definition without navigating away from the current page  
13:51 <vmassol> don't you agree?  
13:54 <sgc072> yes, on hovering a popup will display a small descrption of that word in the dialog box below it. But when the user will click on that word it will direct him to glossary page.  
13:54 <sgc072> Yes link to glossary page should be inside the dialog box.  
13:54 <sgc072> thats better  
13:55 <sgc072> dialog box == popup :P  
14:00 <sgc072> And another question is that whether the definition of the glossary entry will be generated manually?  
14:01 <sgc072>  Or the user will be directed to an already existing page? We just have to link that page with the glossary item.  
14:10 <vmassol> sorry back  
14:11 <vmassol> for adding a glossary item, I already suggested the following:  
14:11 <vmassol> - some user selects one or several works with the mouse  
14:11 <vmassol> - the user clicks a shortcut key (similar to annotations)  
14:12 <vmassol> - this opens a popup allowing the user to enter the definition and to save it  
14:12 <vmassol> - internally this creates a new page in the glossary space  
14:12 <vmassol> (sgc072)  
14:13 <sgc072> yup  
14:13 <sgc072> understood :)  
14:13 <vmassol> cool, unless you have a better proposal ofc :)  
14:16 <sgc072> But in the proposal, its written the definition should be atleast of one page. Isn't it mandatory?  
14:19 <vmassol> the definition shoud be located on a single page yes (for scalability reasons)  
14:19 <vmassol> not at least! exactly on one page  
14:20 <vmassol> s/located/stored  
14:20 <vmassol> the scalability reason is because the alternative would be to store it in an xobject on a single page but xwiki doesn't scale that well when there are too many xobjects on the same page (it takes time to load them all)  
14:21 <vmassol> gtg, be back later  
14:22 <sgc072> ok, thanks

19:02 <sgc\_072> One more thing. On adding a new entry I think the user should be directed to a new page.  
19:02 <sgc\_072> I mean if the definition is quite long, it would look ugly  
19:02 <vmassol> I think it's easier to type in context  
19:03 <vmassol> but what the user could be filling in context could be the summary and he could cick to enter more details maybe  
19:03 <vmassol> \*click  
19:03 <vmassol> (click = navigate to the glossary page)
